评论详情: My husband absolutely loves his new wallet! At first, I wasn’t sure how he’d feel about the smaller size compared to his traditional wallet, but it’s been perfect. It forced him to take out the unnecessary items and only carry the essentials. Plus, the RFID protection is a great bonus. Highly recommend!
This product lasted about a month the cards started falling out on own. Not happy  returned and only got partial return over defective product.

My husband really likes this wallet. He says the quality is great and holds all the cards he uses. He likes the small, slim size too. It also has a spot for an air tag which is important to him. He likes how it looks. One issue is sometimes it takes a couple of tries to pop up the card section, otherwise he’s very happy with it.

It's a very cool looking minimalistic wallet. And it has room for everything I need. But it's difficult to get used to something so different when I have been using a different style for so many years. My old wallet had no flap, the ID holder was on one side and the magnetic money clip was on the other. Between that were leather sleeves for credit cards. This new style actual has a bit more room for more stuff, but the metal is less forgiving in the pocket that my old soft leather version. The cards in this one slap back and forth, unless you fill the inside with exactly the amount of cards to keep them still. The stretchy material on this one to release the cards is rather stiff. Like I say, I want to like this one. It's a 5-star looking wallet, but 3-stars in functionality. Maybe it will take more time to get use to.
It’s a great wallet but thought it would have better functionality when it came to how many cards can be used for. It’s a great quality but if you have a lot of cards they may not all fit.
I like it. It works. It’s very good, especially when I can’t find my wallet my AirTag alerts it.
It’s a little bulky but works great so far

评论概述: Airzoo Wallet for Men, Magnetic Minimalist Slim Wallet, RFID Blocking technology review
评论详情: This is a nice, slim wallet. It is fairly firm and noncorming (like to a back pocket).  It holds all your essential cards and paper money.  Even though it says it's for men, I think it is for anyone.

Front pocket wallets are my new favorite thing. The old style back pocket wallet was giving my husband a lot of back and hip problems. You wouldn't think that something that small could cause that many problems but I promise you it can. This front pocket wallet is great because it's lightweight and it holds all the cards that he needs. It's excellently made and highly durable. I like not only the size but the design which flips open and allows you to grab your cards without having to push them out in some weird way like some other front pocket wallets do.

评论概述: Best of both worlds, traditional and aluminum
评论详情: This wallet features a high-tech design combined with a traditional design and look. It is also small both in the outside dimensions as well as thickness. It opens and closes much like the traditional leather wallet that has been standard for decades. Thus, our ID is secure in a plastic holder, yet it is covered for added security. Inside is the card holder much like the modern aluminum tension wallet. It has several slide pockets on the outside that are handy for those cards, or IDs, that are needed often.  At first I found it difficult to get the cards in and out because of the tension plates. However, after I realized that to put cards in a little pressure on the bottom (small, push opening) of the holder opens the top (larger opening) and the cards easily slide right in. And, I had some difficult getting cards out. But I found if I hold the open wallet on the bottom (as I did to put the cards in) the plates open and I can then easily push the cards out. This sounds more difficult that it is and a couple minutes practice makes it quick and easy.  On the outside is a metal money clip that I would never use and a special screw driver is provided to remove it (it also comes with four additional screws). The first screw I tried to remove wouldn't budge but the other screw came out easily and swinging the money clip back and forth a couple times loosened it enough to easily remove that screw. I then screwed the screws into the wallet (without the clip of course) covering the screw holes.  It is well constructed with solid stitching so it shouldn't come apart. I also like the carbon fiber impression in the leather. It is advertised as being RFID protected and I have to believe the that information.  If you prefer traditional leather wallets, this might not be for you. But if you like money clips and want your cards securely held, this wallet does the job well. Add to this a stylish look and very minimalist wallet, this is worth a look.

Needed a new wallet after mine got washed. I decided to try one with a money clip. It worked well enough, but I got turned off by how tight all the pockets are. Pulling cards out was a chore every time. I figure it will break in eventually, but I'm not interested in putting in 100 reps first. The construction of the wallet is solid. I just wish it all functioned a bit more smoothly.
Love the look & how easy to use. Holds a lot of cards. Great value for cost. Great quality as well
This wallet not only looks nice but is also practical. It slim design fits well in my pants. I use it in my everyday business. It does not take much space, which I like.
The wallet lasted about a week before the piece used to lift the cards broke
This is a top of the line wallet all the way! It’s stylish, thin, and protects.

It comes with a screwdriver and extra screws. Ive used this wallet for a few weeks with no issue though. I like the design although i had to leave a few things out of my typicall wallet mix as they dont fit (pictures, social security card, etc. Overall its a nice wallet for a minimalist.
Purchased this as a Christmas gift for my nephew.  He is loving it so far!

I *hate* shopping for gifts for my teenage nephews, bless their hearts. Nothing against them! They're good kids. But teenage boys in general seem hard to shop for. I saw carbon fiber wallets on a gift list somewhere, and then found this option. I wasn't sure what to expect, but the wallet turned out to be surprisingly good quality. I took it out of the box and hefted it around a bit before I wrapped it up. It seems super solid, with plenty of card slots and a nice elastic band for cash (or whatever). The manufacturer clearly knows their market: it comes in a pretty nice box emblazoned with "GREAT GIFT FOR MAN." No one is going to mistake it for a premium brand, but it's a nice touch. And the most important thing: my nephew loved it! He genuinely seemed thrilled to unwrap it. (Which is more than I can say about some of the other gifts he opened, so hey, uncle for the win!)

Hard and uncomfortable in your pocket. Credit card holder is very difficult to use. If you insert mort than 3 credit cards, it is almost impossible to remove them. Dollar bill holder is on the outside of the wallet and would cut into your pants if you sit on your wallet. Other pockets are very stiff and difficult to use.  Sorry to say I could not find anything I liked about this wallet. But it does look to be well built and may suite some folks need in the way of a wallet.

So, for an initial review of the product, it feels nice. It has a quality feel to it for me, as if it won't wear out and break in a few months. It is a small, slim wallet for those that don't have many cards to keep track of. It can hold 4-5 inside, 1-2 on the front, and 1 on the back where the cash clip is. it does have a magnet that keeps it closed, and so far it is powerful enough to keep the wallet closed even if it is full and you hold it by the top (opposite side of the cash clip).  And yes, it does have a separate holder for your ID when you open the wallet.  Now, the reason why I am taking a star off is because the top (side with no cash clip) is NOT RFID blocking. I checked this with my phone and 4 separate credit cards and my phone was able to read the chip on my cards with no issues whatsoever. It did block RFID on the side with the money clip or if the cards are inside the wallet (even when the wallet is open).  Images included to show the wallet off.
I love this wallet,  its fit my cards very well, i have the option to put some 💸 also. It's easy to use,  its love the minimalist design.Awesome gift

评论概述: Awesome looking, money clip style, wallet
评论详情: This is an interesting and unusual wallet with an extremely high tech design. The Amazon description does an excellent job of explaining its features. The wallet is presented in a classy gift box which contains the wallet, a screwdriver, and four replacement screws for the metal money clip. On the outside of the wallet are two credit card pockets and a metal money clip. The website implies that these pockets do not have RFID protection, thus would be a good place for a subway pass (you scan the card by tapping the wallet on an access reader so wouldn’t need to pull out the card.) Inside is a window pocket for ID, a credit card pocket that holds 5 cards, and an elastic band to hold cash (the wallet will still close properly with a large wad of cash.) Since you have this elastic band, you have the option of unscrewing the metal money clip, allowing the wallet to be slimmer.  Pros - Totally awesome, modern look, like something you’d get at Sharper Image. Much smaller than a conventional wallet (see photo comparing this wallet to my traditional brown wallet.) High quality construction and finish. RFID shielding so no one can scan your cards. Two places to stash cash.  Cons - The core of the wallet is a hard plastic case and there’s that (removable) metal money clip poking out. This means it's too hard and lumpy to put in a back pocket. But it would work great if you wear a suit, have cargo pockets, or roomy front pockets. The other issue is accessing your credit cards; you have to pull all of them out of the plastic case, sort through to find the one you want, then re-stow them. Your cash will go in either the money clip or the elastic band, which presents a similar problem; you have the pull the entire wad to find the bills you need. But if you are used to money clips, this isn’t a problem. (Idea: Maybe put big denomination bills inside and smaller ones outside?) The door to the inner credit card compartment is very stiff and doesn't open very far. Maybe with more use, the elastic will loosen a bit.  Final take - If you are used to traditional wallets with individual credit card slots and a money pocket, this won’t work. But if you are used to money clips and want a smaller wallet that looks REALLY cool, this is the wallet for you.

The first thing that struck me was its slim design. It fits perfectly in my pockets without any bulk, making it ideal for daily wear. Whether I’m heading to work or going out for a night with friends, this wallet slides in seamlessly. It can hold up to 11 cards, which is more than enough for my essentials. I particularly appreciate how easy it is to push out the cards when I need them; it feels effortless and efficient.
this wallet is very nice is spacious. it has nice good leather feel to it. the clip in the back is has strong hold. comes with extra screws and a small screwdriver. it has an extra slot for id.

I really wanted to like this. I saw the listing, and it looked really nice. And so far, it's got promise. The packaging is quite nice. The wallet itself has a nice feel, and a nice design. I felt a bit of excitement, thinking this could be something great.  But it seems to suffer from the usual wallet problem. It's a "minimalist" design, which means you really can't carry much of anything in it. It says it can carry up to 11 cards, but I'm not convinced. It seems like the credit card pocket is a bit tight, and I only put in four cards. It has a magnetic closure, which I really like... in theory.  It has another pocket for ID. My instinct says that would be a bit of a tight fit, but I carry mine elsewhere, so no matter.  The outside pocket seems like a good place for a couple minor papers- lightweight cards (business card stock). But only a couple.  If you want to carry cash, it features an elastic "cash strap" on the inside. Not completely in love with that idea, but it would be only a minor quibble. Except that the bills need to be folded twice (into quarters) to fit inside the wallet without hanging out. And if you do that, then even two or three bills make it bulky. And the lovely magnetic closure becomes ineffective. I suppose the wallet would still be fine, but it worries me. I feel like the elastic will eventually stretch, and then any cash might be at risk. Not really seeing the use. It also has a money clip on the outside, which makes me even more curious about the cash strap. The money clip is fine, but I'm not sure I like carrying money on the outside of my wallet.  I've put my stuff in it, and I'll give it a try for a few days. Maybe it'll grow on me. Maybe I'm not a "minimalist wallet" kinda guy, and I'll need to go back to my old one.  As I said in the headline, I dunno. Maybe it's just my personal needs and wants for a wallet, and it'll be wonderful for someone else with different expectations. It's actually very nice. I like it, but not sure it's adequate for me.

One simple item and I just marked off several of the men on my shopping list this holiday season.  This sleek, stylish wallet is perfect for so many of the men in my family.  It is slim so it doesn't add a lot of bulk to their pockets.  It can hold up to 11 cards which is what most people carry now instead of so much cash.  The cards go in and pull out easily without sticking on the corners of the wallet.  The wallet is made of carbon fiber leather and has very nice hand-stitched details.  This wallet will definitely hold up for quite a while.  It has shielding to protect the cards from electronic theft.  It also has an id window so you don't have to take out your id when you need to show it to someone and has a nice secure money clip built in to it.  They came in a nice little gift box so all I had to do was order them and do a little simple wrapping and place them under the tree and the guys had a very nice gift they will use for a long time.

My most favorite wallet I've ever owned. The black and red is a cool design and it's not bulky or over cumbersome in my pockets. It has an RFD blocker built in so no concerns over my information being stolen at checkout. The money clip is strong, durable, and can hold a lot of bills. Storing your ID, bank cards, and gift cards is now an easy to access and easy to find location. Lightweight but yet extremely durable and made of quality carbon fiber material. If you're looking for a new wallet give this a try; for the price this is the best you will get.
This is a nice travel wallet or front pocket wallet. It is too hard to carry in a back pocket as sitting would be uncomfortable.  It will be durable and provides the privacy needed.

I recently ordered the minimalist Airzoo Wallet for Men, and it was a great choice. It’s slim and made from lightweight aluminum alloy, giving it a stylish appearance. The RFID-blocking technology protects my cards and IDs from unauthorized scanning and identity theft.  The wallet features multiple slots for cash, cards, and IDs, along with a money clip that keeps everything secure. While I wish it allowed me to view all my cards at once instead of stacking some on top of others, I like this wallet. Additionally, the magnetic closure provides extra peace of mind that everything inside will stay secure. It even comes with a screwdriver and extra screws should the money clip ever become loose.  Overall, this is a fine wallet and would make a fine gift.

Something about this makes me wary of bunching up multiple cards and rubbing between each other when trying to take them out.  The carbon fiber design looks good and compact but for me it feels too tight due to some of the cards I carry have a microchip in them and I’m worried this could cause damage due to how tight they are.  I didn’t like the card access process where I have to try to slide out all of the cards then choose the one I need, I don’t want to advertise to the world which cards I own I just want to slide out that one card.  Personally I’d rather keep using my old style wallet where it’s separated by a sleeve.

评论概述: It's HEAVY for a slim wallet
评论详情: I love me some slim wallets. I was attracted to the carbon fiber look. Upon familiarizing myself with this new wallet. I can't help but notice how heavy it is. So it's made well. A little metal box secures about 4 cards it's rfid blocking which is a plus in today's day and age. The size is nice. My only draw backs are the weight. It felt like a stacked wallet when I didn't even add anything to it yet. I carry enough this clipped on mu pants and in many of the cargo pockets I have and it's heavy already. Now to increase the weight of my wallet? I don't know how I feel about that. And the money clip. I guess that could be a hate it or love it. I personally don't use money clips and I feel the clip gets snagged in my pants pocket when trying to retrieve it. So that's something to keep in mind.

The Airzoo Wallet for Men is an absolute game-changer! This newly upgraded magnetic minimalist wallet is super slim and lightweight, making it perfect for everyday use. The RFID blocking feature gives me peace of mind, knowing my cards are safe from skimming. The magnetic closure is strong, keeping everything secure without being bulky. It holds my essentials—cards and cash—while still fitting comfortably in my pocket. If you're looking for a stylish, functional, and secure wallet, this is the one to get. Highly recommend it!

I don't actually have any airtags to put on this, so that bit is kind of extra, but the rest of the wallet is really nice. There are two ID slots inside, and two outer sleeves for your most often-used cards. I use one sleeve for the card I use most often, and the other for carrying a bit of just-in-case cash. The main section holds way more cards than I need to carry daily, but I recently loaded it up with gift cards when I went on vacation and it was really handy to access them all. I recently got this to replace an old, tri-fold wallet that was falling apart, and I'm glad I did. Fits really nicely into my pocket, and has everything I need easily accessed.

I got this wallet as a gift for my husband, and he loves it! The slim design is perfect for carrying in his front pocket, and the magnetic closure feels secure. The RFID blocking is a reassuring touch, especially for travel. The built-in money clip is super convenient for keeping cash organized, and the carbon fiber look is sleek and modern. The included gift box also makes it an impressive presentation. It’s a great mix of functionality and style.

This slim wallet has everything he looks for ... It blocks signals so he's less likely to have his card information stolen, it is slim and sleek, and it doesn't have any complicated screws or assembly stuff to mess with.  Plus it has a strap that he can tuck a few bills away in, yet keep them safe.  The front card holder is for the most used card, and provides him easy access, meaning he doesn't have to open his wallet to get it out.  The interior gives him plenty of room to store his ID and other cards, as well as a little bit of cash.  It closes magnetically, so he doesn't have to worry about it opening as he's getting it out of his pocket or pulling his main card out.  That main card slot also lets him just poke the card out so he doesn't have to remove it all the way as well.

This is a great wallet to stay organized and orderly. The viewing window folds over and holds securely with magnetic clasp. The metal clip and card compartment feels sturdy and secure. The carbon fiber style exterior looks very stylish and modern. Comes with spare screws and screwdriver to help maintain the clip.

评论概述: Too Tight, too secure and RFID unnecessary
评论详情: This wallet really is going to take some getting used to it's very difficult to pick out the cards that I want because it's very very tight I guess that's a good thing they will never fall out. Everything's held in by screws and very tight elastic you can't even get your finger underneath It's so tight. The carbon fiber is legitimate it's not just for looks and not fake plastic. This also isn't like a cotton, nylon/canvas or bonded leather wallet. This construction doesn't break down, disintegrate, bend or flex in any way and they're heavy. This particular wallet is sewn with visible stitches. It is not bonded with glue. A lot of these claim to be lightweight but I have not encountered that. There is going to be a short adjustment period trying to transition from your old wallet to this one. The RFID feature I can't validate. Nor do I really believe that it's possible that someone can remotely scan your cards since the data they get would be missing the necessary identifiers to carry out large scale fraud or in most cases even a simple transaction. I don't believe RFID is necessary when you buy a wallet. I've never encountered any kind of remote scanning of my food stamps card or my Purina®️ cat litter frequent fillers discount card. So I'm not worried about security unless of course I strap one of my popular bank cards to the outside of the wallet. Yes this wallet has pockets and straps on the outside it sounds like a bad idea, as far as security goes, but these cards are safe, secure and don't ever fall out but the location of the can attract attention. I try not to use them even though they take less time to remove when in a line at the grocery store or at the ATM while impatient people are waiting.  This comes with a micro screwdriver which I assume is to adjust the tension on the straps that I haven't done yet because it hasn't become a problem. And I don't care how long I take to get my cards out and I don't care about the ever-growing line of people behind me.  Losing cards from my flimsy wallets is the reason why I wanted this particular kind of wallet. Let's just hope it lasts longer than 6 months that's if I don't lose it first because it is kind of small.

This Airzoo wallet has been a fantastic addition to my everyday carry. The minimalist design is sleek and compact, yet it has plenty of space for all my essentials. The carbon fiber finish gives it a premium feel, and the wallet is lightweight without compromising on durability. The ID window is a thoughtful touch, making it easy to access my ID when needed. It comes in a nice gift box, making it an ideal gift for anyone looking for a practical, stylish wallet. Overall, it’s an excellent choice for anyone wanting a slim, secure, and functional wallet.

I have to say that I have really enjoyed using this wallet due to how thin it is and how comfortable it feels. When you have it on you, you could barely even feel it in your pocket. This is a really nice and unique type of wallet. It is well made and has an air tag to keep track of it in case of emergency. It is well made and sturdy and I have about 6-8 cards plus my DL in it. The money clip is an added bonus though I have never seen a screw on one before it is not a deal breaker as it is very easy to assemble.  Would recommend.

I absolutely love this AirTag Wallet for Men! It has completely exceeded my expectations in terms of both design and practicality. I had a similar wallet to this , but this one is way more superior . The card latch on the side makes it a breeze to take out the exact card I need , no more searching thru my cards . 评论概述: Nice compact credit card wallet, but why doesn't it come fully assembled?
评论详情: I kept misplacing my wallet so decided to get a new card wallet that I could add an Airtag into, and decided to give this one a try.  It's actually a nice compact wallet with a slide lever to pop your cards up when needed, and a place to hold some cash, but you have to install the clip on the back.  It is simple to do so, but I wonder why they didn't just make it already attached.  With the Airtag installed, and the clip installed, it isn't as compact as I would like, but it is still pretty small compared to a normal wallet.  Overall not a bad choice.

This wallet is thicker than some of the other minimalist ones, but that should help in being sure it's still with me, while the airtag holder will help me find it when I eventually lose it anyway. I'm good at that.  The system works well to make loading and retrieving cards easy, even with one hand. The magnetic closure for the display slot works well and holds it together. The airtag holder is just tight enough to hold the tag in place once you squeeze it in. I haven't used the money clip, but it attaches easily and looks like it would work well.  Overall a very good choice for a thicker minimalist wallet.
Well-made wallet, and I like the money clip and the compartment for the AirTag for tracking. That feature has already come in handy a few times when I misplaced my wallet. Great product.

My partner needed a new wallet and I knew he wanted one with an air tag holder and had a card holder that had the card ejector thing. I stumbled across this one and I am glad that I ordered it. Its made out of metal or some other hard material and so its very sturdy. Although its hefty, it still maintains a slim profile because all the cards are in the card holder. The card holder itself is super sturdy and its pretty much impossible for the cards to come out even if you shake the wallet upside down. The air tag holder fit the air tag we had. Overall, my partner loves it and it was a great purchase.

I recently got the AirTag Wallet for Men, and it’s been awesome! The best part is the built-in AirTag holder, which has completely eliminated my worries about losing my wallet. Now, I can easily track it using my phone if it ever gets misplaced. The wallet is also very durable and holds all my cards and cash perfectly. Overall, it’s a fantastic blend of modern technology and classic functionality. Highly recommended for anyone who wants peace of mind and a great looking wallet!

"Where have you been my whole life?", I asked my wallet.  This magnetic wallet is the best minimalistic addition to my life since I have been alive.  What else is there to say.  I no longer have to carry around a bulky wallet that creates a bulge in my front pocket.  I have a tendency to store everything in my front pockets.  I have a tendency to sometimes lose my wallet because of mental condition.  Now I no longer go anywhere without attaching this wallet to my smartphone using the built-in magnet.  As a result I misplace my wallet much less often.I can comfortably carry my Driver's License, ATM-Card and 3 other credit cards within this wallet.  When I need a card I simply slide the black switch down on my wallet and all of my cards pop up for me.  I can then choose the one I need at anytime.  Whenever I go to the convenience store or box store, the cashier and people around me marvel at this wallet and ask me where they can purchase one.This is the best wallet I have ever owned.  I've dropped countless times and the trigger spring always works.  It's VERY DURABLE!I will never go back to a conventional wallet again.  Like I said this is the greatest personal minimalistic device I have ever owned, not counting my smartphone.

I ordered this wallet for my husband. He doesn't like carrying a large wallet but this has enough room for his driver's license & credit/debit cards, etc. The card slot for the credit card has a button that pushes the cards up to easily access them. This function work but it does not work smoothly. Sometimes it will push up all of the cards & sometimes only 2 cards. He loves that it is RFID blocking because his cards have been hacked in the past & also that it has the air tag space built in. Overall, he really likes this wallet except for the jerky way the push button part works sometimes.
Exactly what I wanted and needed, holds all my necessary cards perfectly and with an airtag.

评论概述: really nice slim wallet great gift

This is a nice quality feeling wallet.  It holds plenty of cards and feels nice, however with the money clip, the card area and the air tag it is just as thick as a regular wallet.

评论概述: Compact and convenient to use until it isn't
评论详情: *Update 12/3/24 - my husband has used this wallet since September 3rd, merely 3 months. The card holder feature has failed and now the cards fall out every time he pulls it out of his pocket. Obviously it's no longer safe to use and has been thrown away.  This is a great security wallet. I like that the cards push up with a flick of a switch which makes them easy to see and remove. The leather feels and looks good. I don't use the belt clip for wearing it, but it could be used instead to clip receipts. I do wish there was a specified place for receipts, though, which is the only negative in my opinion. I don't used the airtag but it is a nice feature if desired.

评论概述: Clunky, magnet doesn't work, cash storage is bad, spring loading is stiff. Not a fan
评论详情: Wanted this to be my everyday wallet. This is my second minimalist wallet and my other is far superior  This is a nice wallet from initial impression and it feels really nice in your hand. Soft velvet like material and compact with lots of card slots  But almost everything else about the wallet is inferior once you start to use it. The push button for the cards is finicky and didn't work a few times I tried it. Even when it did work, the cards slowly emerged and often clumped together. I really worry about it failing in time and cards being stuck. But even if that doesn't happen, I was finding I needed to manually pull the cards anyways And I didn't overload. It is supposed to hold 7 cards and I was only trying with 4 cards to see the mechanism  The folding and magnet close was one of main features that intrigued me to order. The magnet is good and works well, ONLY IF you do not utilize the card slots. Once you load any cards, it is too weak to magnetize closed. But what would be the point of that? What good is the fold at all if you can't put in any cards without the magnet then being to weak to close?  Overall, this is an inferior product that fails over and over. The large storage is a lie from my experience. It holds likely about 7-8 cards MAX. With all the pockets and storage, it should be far more but then the pockets start not closing or just not working properly. Cash storage is very limited and difficult to insert and remove. I think there are far better options on the market. They may cost slightly more but are significantly better. I would not recommend
